Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. If the organism were able to undergo self-fertilization, (a) what is the probability that the first progeny will have a genotype identical to that of the parent? (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

<|im_start|>user
Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. If the organism were able to undergo self-fertilization, (a) what is the probability that the first progeny will have a genotype identical to that of the parent? (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. If the organism were able to undergo self-fertilization, (a) what is the probability that the first progeny will have a genotype identical to that of the parent? (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. If the organism were able to undergo self-fertilization, (a) what is the probability that the first progeny will have a genotype identical to that of the parent? (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. If the organism were able to undergo self-fertilization, (a) what is the probability that the first progeny will have a genotype identical to that of the parent? (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

(b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Homozygous means both alleles are the same, either AA, BB, etc. In selfing, the probability of an individual being homozygous depends on how many ways they can get two copies of the same allele. Each gene pair has four possible combinations when selfing: AA, Aa, aA, aa. But since the parents are heterozygotes, the gametes received are A or a. So for each gene, the probability of having AA is 1/4, and aa is also 1/4. Therefore, for each gene pair, the probability of being homozygous is 1/4. With five gene pairs, the probability that all are homozygous is (1/4)^5 = 1/1024. However, wait—homos mean any gene being homozygous. So actually, we need to calculate the probability that at least one gene is homozygous. This is different because each gene can independently be homozygous or not. The probability of at least one homozygous gene is 1 minus the probability that none are homozygous. The probability that a particular gene isn't homozygous is 3/4 (since AA is 1/4, aa is 1/4, so 2/4). For five independent genes, it's (3/4)^5. So 1 - (3/4)^5 is approximately 1 - 0.2373 = 0.7627, but as a fraction, it's 1 - (243/1024) = 781/1024. Wait, but looking back, the options given don't include fractions over 1024 except for some. Alternatively, perhaps I made a mistake here. Let me think again. The question asks for the proportion of the total progeny that is homozygous. Since each gene pair is independent, the number of homozygous individuals would depend on whether they're homozygous for at least one gene. But calculating the exact probability requires considering all possibilities where at least one gene is homozygous. Using inclusion-exclusion principle, the probability is sum P(A_i) - sum P(A_i ∧ A_j) + ... ± P(A_1 ∧ A_2 ∧ ... ∧ A_n). For n=5, it's 5*(1/4) - 10*(1/16) + 10*(1/64) - 5*(1/256) + 1*(1/1024). Calculating this:

First term: 5*(1/4) = 5/4.

Second term: 10*(1/16)=10/16=5/8.

Third term:10*(1/64)=10/64=5/32.

Fourth term:5*(1/256)=5/256.

Fifth term:1*(1/1024).

Now, putting them together:

5/4 - 5/8 + 5/32 - 5/256 + 1/1024.

Convert all to 1024 denominator:

5/4 = 1280/1024,

-5/8 = -640/1024,

+5/32 = +160/1024,

-5/256 = -20/1024,

+1/1024 remains.

Adding up: 1280 - 640 + 160 - 20 + 1 = 781.

So 781/1024. Looking at the options, option B is 1/16, 3/16, 729/1024; option E is 1/32, 1/32, 255/1024. None of these seem to match 781/1024. Maybe I did something wrong. (c) Assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters. Complete dominance means that the presence of even one dominant allele masks the effect of other alleles. So for each gene pair, if an organism receives at least one dominant allele, its phenotype is dominant. Therefore, the total number of individuals who express the dominant phenotype for all five characters would be those who are not homozygous recessive in any gene pair. The only homozygous recessive genotype is when all genes are homozygous for the recessive allele. There's only one such genotype, which is the homozygous recessive for all five genes. Thus, the proportion is 1 - 1/1024 = 1023/1024. Looking at the options, option A is 1023/1024. So that might be the answer. 

But wait, another thought: the question says "the total progeny," which includes all possible genotypes. H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. If the organism were able to undergo self-fertilization, (a) what is the probability that the first progeny will have a genotype identical to that of the parent? (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024
